messages.message:
Hey team, I have been asked about a use case for using a Chatbot to check query documents vs guideline documents. I know we have this feature as internal preview at least. Couple of questions on this:
• Can this be done via API? 
    ◦ If not, do we have plans to make it so?
• The customer wants to run a check for each document passing through their Build app. Do we see any issues with using a custom function/validation function to call the Converse APIs to run a check?
    ◦ This would be passing the required extracted info through the Converse prompt (instead of using a file to query for now)
    ◦ Some related discussion was here: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1737528121883679
cc: @Balaram @margaret.tomaszczuk for plans on query docs API

Great - thanks @Balaram. We have a call 9am UK time on Wednesday with the customer who is running a POC on AI Hub atm and will tell us more about the use case and ask how we can solve for it.

Would you (or someone else) like to be added to the call?
Thanks for surfacing this, team! +1 to Balaram's feedback. Very curious to understand use case for API with this feature esp.
Forwarded you both more details on the use case from UOB

Sharing for visibility - I've seen 2 use-cases this past week that are somewhat similar:

1. P&G's artworks (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wrPyN7-AFJzDJ6Zgr4itOZXxFwl6WDkvomB-ZhWl1wY/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.6vznq1yjcmi9)
2. GNP (prospect) wanted to process contracts to see if they complied with policies & regulations. The regulations could change contract to contract, and are sometimes too long to fit in a prompt. They were going to start with Converse using APIs, but if they wanted to build in a validations & review workflow, would need to use Build.
